column5: Hi guys, I remember as a kid going to a fly-in fishing trip for with my dad about 25 years ago from I think, Lake St John Airport, near Orillia, to Lake Bolyea?--not too far away anyway. Has anyone been on a fly-in lately? What is the price going for these days? any good/bad experiences? thx
Your best bet would probably be to go the the Toronto Sportsman show and talk to one of the many fly-in outfitters that will have booths setup there  ...
I betcha its these guys...  Stanton Air... tell them TJ sent ya...  flyins ares usually awesome, check this out.  http://ontarioflyinoutposts.net/
http://www.trophypikecanada.com/  Pretty good bang for your buck  http://www.armstrongoutposts.com/  Great host and five different outpost  Good luck in your search
thanks TJ! exactly what I was looking for..even found where we went! thanks guys too for the other ones..will check them out as well

Check out Arctic Watershed Outposts out of Nakina.  They will be at the Toronto show.  www.awonakina.com.  I have used them 12 time with #13 this  June.  Great fishing, facilities, equipment, and owners.  Saly hello th Christine and Remi for me,  Dave Kean from Ohio.
Other Nakina outfitters that are a notch above AWO and offer outstanding fishing on single cabin lakes are:  www.luenberger.ca  http://www.timberidgefishing.com/lakes.htm
